text: Cody Webb (born May 31, 1988), is an American professional motorcycle trials rider and endurocross racer. Webb was the 2010 United States NATC Motorcycle Trials Champion. Webb has also competed in EnduroX. At the X Games he has claimed silver medals in Foz do Iguaçu 2013 and Los Angeles 2012 and 2014, as well as bronze medals in Los Angeles 2013 and Barcelona 2013. Also, he has won the 2014, 2015 and 2017 AMA EnduroCross Championship. ==Biography== Born in Watsonville, California, Webb turned professional in 2003 after clinching the NATC Expert title and won his first Pro trial in Tennessee in 2006, going on to finish 2nd in the championship behind Geoff Aaron. Cody Webb continued to be a contender for the title over the next few years, winning the NATC Indoor Championship in 2007 and finishing runner-up to Patrick Smage in 2007 through 2009 before taking the outdoor championship in 2010. In 2011 Smage regained his title with Webb again finishing runner-up. ==NATC Trials Championship Career== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:95%" ! Year ! Team !
